CIRCULAR  NO.   30 /  2002 
 
 
Sub : PREPARATION OF CONTINGENCY PLAN  
 
 
In view of the current sur-charged situation due to security threats, it has 
become imperative to review the efficacy of the contingency plan of the airports 
and the readiness to meet any emergency arising out of any kind of unlawful 
interference with civil aviation operations.  Instructions issued vide this Bureau 
Circular No. CAS-8 (49)-93 Div-I dated 2.3.1993 regarding convening meeting of 
the Aerodrome Committee once in six months, are reiterated.  It is requested that 
all concerned be made fully aware of their respective roles and responsibilities in 
the event of a contingency.  Physical checks and operational fitness of all ground 
arrangements available to meet a contingency including communication system 
may be undertaken and ensured.  A meeting of the Aerodrome Committee if not 
convened in the month of July 2002 may be convened immediately.  All annexure 
of the Contingency plan including list of the Aerodrome Committee members, 
panel of Doctors / hospital, panel of local negotiators need be updated on a 
regular basis and circulated to all concerned. 
 
 
A report regarding action taken may be sent to BCAS HQrs along with a 
copy of the minutes of the meeting and updated annexure. 
 
 
This issues with the approval of Ministry of Civil Aviation. 
 
(R.K. Singh) 
Addl   Commissioner  of  Security (CA) 
 
Ref. No. CAS-5 (1)/2002-DIV-1     dated 26.09.2002
